intro: Delissea knudsenii, commonly known as the Knudsen's delissea, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
